As Pete enters from the hallway, he catches a glimpse of Larry and discreetly turns around, avoiding being noticed by anyone. Suddenly, a door slams, making Debbie gasp in surprise. This prompts Debbie to begin searching through the iPad for more information. Meanwhile, Debbie is seen seated in Dr. Pelligrino's office; her expression is a mystery. However, as she drives away, after a few moments of contemplation, a wide, joyous smile spreads across her face.

They hold hands and smile at each other as they pull up to their house in the quiet suburbs, shut off the car, and sit for a beat, knowing they're about to head back into the stress of the real world, where work and family await, and not wanting their peaceful, loving time to end. Sadie and her friend Wendy run around the yard with Charlotte and the triplets, whose energy never seems to run out. Larry, a family friend and neighbor, and Debbie greet the kids when they enter the kitchen with cookies they've just baked. Larry picks up one of the triplets, and Charlotte leaves with the triplets, all vying for his attention. Larry takes some of the food she's throwing out, grateful for the extra snacks. Wendy exits, and Sadie runs off, eager to join her for the latest dance class. Pete enters from the hallway, sees Larry, and turns around before anyone notices him, not in the mood for small talk. Pete and Debbie are in bed, and Pete is reading Sadie's iChats on her confiscated iPad out loud to Debbie, trying to understand their teenage daughter's world. They hear a door slam, and Debbie gasps, worried about the boundaries they might be crossing. Debbie starts looking through the iPad, curious about the friends Sadie has been texting. Pete's iPhone chimes, and he sees a message from Ronnie, a colleague who often shares office gossip, from work. He looks over at Debbie, who is oblivious, her focus still on the iPad. Pete paces, anxiety building over the new project deadline. Pete enters and walks into Ronnie's office, where Ronnie, an inventive marketer known for his eccentric ideas, is drawing on a blackboard behind his desk. Pete walks out of Ronnie's office and into the main office space, and Ronnie follows, ready to brainstorm a new strategy. Debbie sits in Dr. Pellegrino's office, an esteemed therapist recognized for his empathetic approach, and then she drives away. We cannot tell what she is feeling, but after a few beats, a joyous smile appears across her face, perhaps a sign of the breakthrough she needed.

Larry picks up one of the triplets and Charlotte leaves with the triplets. Larry takes some of the food she is throwing out. Wendy exits and Sadie runs off. Pete enters from the hallway sees Larry and turns around before anyone notices him. Pete and Debbie are in bed and Pete is reading Sadie's iChats on her confiscated iPad out loud to Debbie. They hear a door slam and Debbie gasps. Debbie starts looking through the iPad. Pete's iPhone chimes and he sees a message from Ronnie from work. He looks over at Debbie who is oblivious. Pete paces. Pete is driving while Sadie and Charlotte sing show tunes loudly and happily. Pete is very upset about the record not selling as Debbie talks to their ACCOUNTANT. Pete enters and walks into Ronnie's office where Ronnie is drawing on a blackboard behind his desk. Pete walks out of Ronnie's office and into the main office space and Ronnie follows. Debbie sits in Dr Pelligrino's office and then she drives away. We cannot tell what she is feeling but after a few beats a joyous smile appears across her face.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Samantha rolls on the grass while Max lounges on a hammock. Max hops up with a parrot dangling from his hat. They devour picnic snacks, including pickles and pastries and all sorts of things. She attempts to juggle them, and Max is thrilled. Max and Samantha sail back from Venice, appearing very cheerful and rejuvenated. They clap hands and grin at each other as they dock at their cabin, switch off the engine, and pause for a moment, knowing they're about to dive back into the chaos of everyday life and not wanting their serene, affectionate time to conclude. Nikki hops outside, trailed by Jamie. Oliver is laughing uncontrollably and stands on the bench. Max and Samantha are debating with Dr. Torino, an exotic scientist with both a dialect and a stutter. Max jogs with the team while Samantha searches around the cabin for Max. Samantha discovers Max on the hammock, with his arms in the air. He still wears his running shirt but is unclothed from the waist up, attempting to examine his shoulder while holding a magnifying glass and a tablet. Max has his bare arms hoisted over his head, and Samantha takes a fleeting peek underneath. Samantha converses with Jamie while they iron garments and observe Leslie. Samantha walks over to Leslie, who selects a hat and begins to put on all her outfits in front of Samantha. Samantha pinches Leslie's cheeks. Max is in his den on the line with his BAKER. Nikki and her buddy Maddie race around the garden with Oliver and the twins. Gary and Samantha welcome the children as they enter the dining room. Gary lifts one of the twins, and Oliver departs with the twins. Gary collects some of the trinkets she's giving away. Maddie departs, and Nikki dashes away. Max enters from the corridor, notices Gary, and quickly retreats before anyone spots him. Max and Samantha are on the hammock, and Max is reciting Nikki's texts on her seized tablet aloud to Samantha. They hear a window shut, and Samantha gasps. Samantha begins browsing through the tablet. Max's tablet beeps, and he sees a note from Henry from the studio. He glances at Samantha, who is unaware. Max strolls. Max is flying while Nikki and Oliver chant sea shanties loudly and joyously. Max is very distressed about the painting not being appreciated as Samantha chats with their ARTIST. Max arrives and wanders into Henry's studio, where Henry is doodling on a canvas behind his easel. Max strolls out of Henry's studio and into the gallery space, and Henry trails. Samantha sits in Dr. Franco's studio, and then she cruises away. We cannot discern what she is experiencing, but after a few pauses, an ecstatic grin spreads across her face.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby cafÃ©, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Debbie and Pete enjoy a refreshing getaway in Laguna, but their return home brings them back to daily stresses. Pete and Debbie deal with family momentsâ€”Sadie's iChats, Charlotte's tears, and the chaos of the kids playing. Pete has a humorous moment trying to inspect his backside with a mirror and phone, while Debbie interacts with Jodi and Desi, sharing a playful encounter. Pete struggles with work stress, receiving a message from Ronnie about poor record sales as Debbie consults their accountant. Meanwhile, Debbie visits Dr. Pelligrino, leaving ambiguously but eventually smiles joyously. Throughout, Pete and Debbie navigate work and family life, seeking brief respites from their hectic routine.
